title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 15, ch. I, subch. J, pt. 134 - Alcohol And Drug Rehabilitation Programs
content:

State Regulations
§ 134.1 - Introduction
§ 134.2 - Persons eligible for program
§ 134.3 - Court action upon conviction of a violation of section 1192 of the Vehicle and Traffic Law
§ 134.4 - Initial procedures by the department of motor vehicles upon receipt of a certificate of conviction for a violation of section 1192 of the vehicle and traffic law
§ 134.5 - Procedures to be followed by defendant who receives notification of eligibility for enrollment in a rehabilitation program
§ 134.6 - Waiver required
§ 134.7 - Criteria for issuance of a conditional license
§ 134.8 - Repealed
§ 134.9 - Conditional license
§ 134.10 - Completion of a rehabilitation program
§ 134.11 - Issuance of unconditional driver's license
§ 134.12 - Notification to the court
§ 134.13 - Out-of-state convictions
§ 134.14 - Fees
§ 134.15 - Establishment of alcohol and drug rehabilitation programs
§ 134.16 - Confidentiality of records
§ 134.17 - Repealed
§ 134.18 - Conditional license issued pending prosecution

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 15, ch. I, subch. J, pt. 134

Statutory authority: Vehicle and Traffic Law, §§ 215[a], 510[6],521, 530, 1192, 1193, 1196, 1198

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
